meanings.definition: Occurring or belonging to every day
meanings.sent1: The quotidians tasks like brushing teeth help maintain good hygiene.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the quotidians sunrise that painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent3: His quotidians habit of checking the mailbox at midnight always made the neighbors chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The quotidians rhythm of the waves crashing against the shore was like nature's lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The quotidians routine of watering the plants brought a sense of calm to her hectic days.

meanings.sent1: He picked up the quotidians to catch up on the latest news.

meanings.sent5: Reading the quotidians with a cup of coffee became his morning ritual.
